    • Class dkeep.logic.Dungeon extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • dungeon

          GameObject[][] dungeon
          Represents a dungeon without characters, only walls, empty spaces, doors and levers(only the skeleton)

        • dungeonInstant

          GameObject[][] dungeonInstant
          Represents a populated dungeon(with all characters) Look at it as the complete/final version of the dungeon

    • Class dkeep.logic.Game extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • gameState

          GameState gameState
          stores information about what features will be in the game, such as weapons, ability to attack, guard personality, etc.

        • dungeon

          Dungeon dungeon
          represents the board

        • hero

          Hero hero
          represents the character the user will controll

        • genericWallTile

          Wall genericWallTile
          represents a game element used to limit the map

        • genericEmptyTile

          Empty genericEmptyTile
          represents a game element which is empty, to where other characters can move

        • doors

          java.util.ArrayList<E> doors
          a list with all the doors currently present in the game

        • npcs

          java.util.ArrayList<E> npcs
          a list with all the npcs currently present in the game

        • allObjects

          java.util.ArrayList<E> allObjects
          a list with all the elements currently present in the game

    • Class dkeep.logic.GameObject extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • symbol

          char symbol
          Symbol that represents the object when displayed on screen

        • coordinates

          Point coordinates
          Current coordinates of the object position

        • passable

          boolean passable
          True if other objects can move to the same position as this, false otherwise

        • movable

          boolean movable
          True if the object moves, false otherwise

    • Class dkeep.logic.GameState extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • movingEnemies

          boolean movingEnemies
          Indicates if there will be moving enemies in game

        • attackingEnemies

          boolean attackingEnemies
          Indicates if there will be enemies attacking the hero

        • attackingEnemiesWeapons

          boolean attackingEnemiesWeapons
          Indicates if the enemies will have weapons(ogre-club)

        • attackingHero

          boolean attackingHero
          Indicates if the hero will be able to attack(stun ogres)

        • guardPersonality

          Guard.Personality guardPersonality
          Indicates the personality of the existing guard

        • ogreQuantity

          int ogreQuantity
          Indicates the ogre quantity(3 by default)

        • running

          boolean running
          Indicates the game runnign state

        • currentLevel

          int currentLevel
          Indicates the current level

        • dungeonModel

          int[][] dungeonModel
          The begging state of dungeon(complete model) of the current level

    • Class dkeep.logic.Guard extends Character implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • sleepTime

          int sleepTime
          Measured in rounds/plays Drunken guard: measures the time left until the stun effect ends Suspicious guard: measures when how many time has gone by since the last turn around(takes negative value)

        • personality

          Guard.Personality personality
          guard personality

        • movementList

          java.lang.String[] movementList
          guard movement path

        • nextMovement

          int nextMovement
          index of movement list tells what the next move will be

        • movingDirection

          int movingDirection
          set to 1 if movement is accordingly to the movement list set to -1 if movement is in opposite order of the movement list
